articles.content:
Meeting of Koreans in U.S. held 
    Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- Koreans in the United States reportedly held a meeting for jointly conducting the reunification movement in Los Angeles between July 4 and 6.
 The meeting was attended by compatriots who are struggling for Korea's reunification in various regions of Americas.    
Speeches were made and a lecture was given at the meeting and then a resolution was adopted.    
 The resolution said that the publication of the June 15 joint declaration made it possible for the 70 million fellow countrymen to turn out in a historic march to pave the way for reunification by the concerted efforts of the Korean nation. 
 The joint declaration is, indeed, a landmark for opening the door of reunification, the resolution said, and continued: 
 We will achieve the great national unity together with the compatriots at home and abroad to bring earlier national reunification.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam arrives in Jakarta
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam arrives in Jakarta 
    Jakarta, July 10 (KCNA correspondent) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, arrived in Jakarta Wednesday afternoon by a special plane to pay an official goodwill visit to the Republic of Indonesia at the invitation of President Megawati Soekarnoputri.
 Also arriving here were Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun, Minister of Foreign Trade Ri Kwang Gun, president of the Academy of Sciences Ri Kwang Ho, acting chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries Mun Jae Chol, and other suite members.    
 They were greeted at the airport by Indonesian Foreign Minister Hasan Wirayuda, Minister of State for Communications and Information Syamsul Muarif, officials concerned and DPRK Ambassador to Indonesia Jang Chang Chon and his embassy officials.

Greetings to President of Sao Tome and Principe
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Sao Tome and Principe
    Pyongyang, July 11 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday sent a message of greetings to President of Sao Tome and Principe Frederique De Menezes on the occasion of the 27th anniversary of its independence and the proclamation of the Democratic Republic.
 In the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger, the message sincerely wished the president, government and people of Sao Tome and Principe great success in their work for the prosperity of the country.
